title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.24 | 05-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: The personality of God is Sri Krishna out of his causeless mercy.
segments.summary: This segment explains that Krishna incarnates out of causeless mercy, not influenced by material qualifications, and cannot be attracted through material means.

segments.key_quote: If you want his mercy, you have to render devotional service.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that Krishna is pleased by devotional service and taking shelter of a pure devotee, highlighting the transcendental position of both the Lord and His devotees.

segments.key_quote: He descends out of his causeless mercy only to reclaim the fallen souls.
segments.summary: This segment explains that Krishna is beyond the material world and descends out of causeless mercy to reclaim fallen souls who desire material enjoyment.

segments.key_quote: The lord comes to reclaim the fallen conditioned souls.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how the illusory energy captivates fallen souls, leading them to make plans for material enjoyment, and how the Lord arranges for them to take shelter of His lotus feet and become spiritually enlightened.

segments.key_quote: The supreme lord who incarnates for the sake of reclaiming the fallen conditioned souls, He is very very kind to these fallen souls.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the Lord's kindness in incarnating to reclaim fallen souls and making arrangements for them to turn their attention towards Him, glorifying Srila Prabhupada and previous acharyas for the same mission.

segments.key_quote: By seeing Tursi, one becomes purified in the heart.
segments.summary: This segment explains how Tulsi assists in reclaiming conditioned souls through purification, and how the material energy influences them to seek enjoyment in material nature under false pretenses.

segments.key_quote: Our real enjoyment is in the spiritual world.
segments.summary: This segment highlights that material energy presents illusion, and real enjoyment lies in the spiritual world with Krishna, emphasizing the importance of faith in the Acharya for purification and liberation.

segments.key_quote: Originally everyone is a servant of Krishna.
segments.summary: This segment explains that everyone is originally a servant of Krishna but forgets this truth when desiring material enjoyment, and the Lord's all-merciful nature is exhibited when He comes to reclaim fallen souls.
